summary: I’m pretty pessimistic about this whole thing just because Maisie Williams said she filmed her last scene in the show alone...
question: I’m pretty pessimistic about this whole thing just because Maisie Williams said she filmed her last scene in the show alone which would fit with her leaving Westeros
answer: Well, i took as she filmed alone her last scene as in the scene she last filmed, not her last scene of the series, since they film things out of orde and she could be filming anything. But who knows, maybe thats it.

summary: So Arya is still choosing vengeance because fuck her character development this regresses her from choosing to go back to...
question: So Arya is still choosing vengeance because fuck her character development this regresses her from choosing to go back to winterfell instead of kings landing in s6 fu k d&d it isn’t even just about gendraya it’s about them butchering Arya as a character

summary: Ok...nevermind that D&D totally didn’t read between the lines of what “Tha’t’s not me’’ should mean in terms of what Arya would...
body:
Ok…nevermind that D&D totally didn’t read between the lines of what “Tha’t’s not me’’ should mean in terms of what Arya would do ( changing the very idea of what a lady should or should not be or do) and went for a literal interpretation, so now the best we could hope is Gendry giving up on the StormLands ( IF he is really being legitimized) and them together without making official…because i don’t see Arya changing her mind on wanting to marry him ( being him a Lord or not).

So basically what does she wants of Gendry who told her he never had a family and she told him she could be his ( and we know at that time she was in love with him, as per writers and Arya)? Does she want him with her in any way even if not “by the law”? Or  was he just a laid for one night, a fuck buddy, even if she knows would mean more to her best friend she used to love?

If he indeed gets his title, is it fair to ask Gendry to give up too and do just what Arya wants to, if she can’t even truly want a family with him? or does she wants as long as he is not a Lord?

When he gave up on staying it was because she was a lady and he just a bastard who wouldnt be able to be with her…

It left me with a very bitter taste on what D&D is doing with Arya and how she treats the people around her and that she has not matured to understand the power she sould have and the good of it and reformulating the whole concept of a lady…she’s my favorite character but i also love Gendry and think from his POV too…and my real problem is that i’m not seeing any character development on Arya ( not just for Gendrya stuff) and that’s sad as fuck.

I couldn’t be more disappointed with this show.

summary: “Lyanna was beautiful,” Arya said, startled. [...]
body:
“Lyanna was beautiful,” Arya said, startled. […]

“She was,” Eddard Stark agreed, “beautiful, willful, and dead before her time.”

—Arya, A Game of Thrones by George R.R. Martin

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: “You have a wildness in you, child. ‘The wolf blood,’ my father used to call it. Lyanna had a touch of it, and my brother...
body:
“You have a wildness in you, child. ‘The wolf blood,’ my father used to call it. Lyanna had a touch of it, and my brother Brandon more than a touch. It brought them both to an early grave.”

—Eddard (Arya II), A Game of Thrones by George R.R. Martin

reblog.comment:
“You have a wildness in you, child. ‘The wolf blood,’ my father used to call it. Lyanna had a touch of it, and my brother Brandon more than a touch. It brought them both to an early grave.”

—Eddard (Arya II), A Game of Thrones by George R.R. Martin

trail.content_raw:
“You have a wildness in you, child. ‘The wolf blood,’ my father used to call it. Lyanna had a touch of it, and my brother Brandon more than a touch. It brought them both to an early grave.”

—Eddard (Arya II), A Game of Thrones by George R.R. Martin

—Eddard (Arya II), A Game of Thrones by George R.R. Martin

summary: To all the Arya fans who have read the GOT leaks about the last 3 episodes and aren't happy, take heart and know this is not...
body:
To all the Arya fans who have read the GOT leaks about the last 3 episodes and aren’t happy, take heart and know this is not GRRM’s planned ending for our girl.

GRRM said on record multiple times he hasn’t worked on the show since S4. He told D & D his planned ending during S3 but he didn’t work on any scripts starting S5. He was asked if he worked on the show or even read the scripts for S8 and he said no. He said they “should” have the same ending but in recent interviews, GRRM has cast doubts that it would be the same. D & D recently said they changed some parts of the ending to keep the book ending a surprise. And when one of the writers was asked if the show’s ending will match the books, he said he thought the show would honor the spirit of the series ending. That doesn’t sound like they’ll have the same ending to me.

And despite popular belief, GRRM didn’t have final script approval on the show. The changes D & D made weren’t always what GRRM had planned or done with his blessings. GRRM wrote outlines for future seasons prior to his departure from the show. One outline included the marriage of Ramsay Bolton to “Arya Stark” and had a note that the dire wolves will be set against Bolton’s dogs. GRRM intended the North to rally for Arya in the show as they did in the books. Arya was still connected to the North despite being on a different continent.

Show Arya is not Book Arya. Book Arya isn’t only out for revenge, her family and pack have always been very important to her, Nymeria has not abandoned her, Jon died for her, Bran misses her, she’s not the same as Lady Stoneheart, and she has never forgotten who she was no matter how hard she tried. The Old Gods spoke to her to remind her who she was, no one else in the book series got that. Despite what some people that work on the show say, Arya is a Stark, never stopped being a Stark, and will always be a Stark. When Arya finally returns home, she won’t willingly leave it.

If you think the show ending for Arya is out of character for her, it’s because it is. That’s not Arya at all. I’m not sure what GRRM has in store for Arya but I can practically guarantee her ending won’t be the same as the show’s.

summary: God, I’m really really loving A Feast For Crows. I’m very very worried about Arya, because becoming No One sounds like such a...
body:
God, I’m really really loving A Feast For Crows. I’m very very worried about Arya, because becoming No One sounds like such a bad idea, but she’s still very far from that. She’s still repeating the names of those she hates, she couldn’t bring herself to get rid of Needle, and she chose Cat as a name (you know, after her mother. She might not have said it, but I’m betting she picked it for her mother).

Speaking of Stark girls, I’m also so fucking proud and worried for Sansa. She’s growing so fast and she should’t have to. My baby.

blog.name: the-bisexual-disaster
blog.title: Proud Member of the Arya Stark Defence Club
blog.description: Kat, 17, she/they. Respect Carol Danvers and Arya Stark or die by my battleaxe

summary:
Jon: You lost a lot of blood and passed out. Do you remember anything?
Arya: Only the ambulance ride to the hospital
Gendry:...
body:
Jon: You lost a lot of blood and passed out. Do you remember anything?

Arya: Only the ambulance ride to the hospital

Gendry: That wasn’t an ambulance. I drove you

Arya: But I heard sirens

Jon: That was Sansa

Sansa: I WAS WORRIED
